9308H0637-d-08-30-93-SOO.Narrative: WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN T005-6 WAS PICKING UP 23 CARS AT SOO LINE HUMBOLDT YARD WHEN THE 19TH THRU 21ST HEAD CARS DERAILED. ONE OF THE DERAILED CARS FELL ON ITS SIDE AND ITS LADING OF PAPER PULP NEEDED TO BE TRANSLOADED. THE WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN CREW HAD MADE THE MOVEMENT ON INSTRUCTION FROM THESOO LINE YARDMASTER, BUT THE SWITCH WAS NOT PROPERLY LINED AND THE CARS PICKED THE WEST DIVIDE SWITCH. A FORMAL INVESTIGATION/HEARING WAS SCHEDULED AND SUBSEQUENTLY CANCELLED UPON RECEIPT OFA SIGNED REQUESTED WAIVER FROM SOO YARDMASTER WHO ACCEPTED RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE DERAILMENT. SOO YARDMASTER WAS ASSESSED THE FOLLOWING DISCIPLINE AND RECORDED ON HIS PERSONAL RECORD: TEN(10) DAYS OF SUSPENSIONDEFFERED FOR A PERIOD OF ONE (1) YEAR FOR VIOLATION OF RULE 104(A) OF THE GENERAL CODE OF OPERATINGRULES, SECOND EDITION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

93222005-d-08-10-93-SCAX.Narrative: APPROXIMATELY 1:30PM, ENGINE SP8303, HAD DEPARTED THE SHOP, HEADING TOWARDS TAYLOR YARD. CE DOOLEY WAS WORKING HIS REGULAR JOBS AS OPERATOR ON JOB 631 AND MG MUNOZ WAS WORKING OFF THE EXTRA BOARD AS HELPER ON JOB #641. BOTH WENT ON DUTY AT 7:00AM. AS THE MOVEMENT PROCEEDED FROM THE SHOPS, LONG HOODLEADING MOVEMENT, MUNOZ PLACED HIMSELF ON THE FIREMAN'S SEAT, CALLING OUT SIGNALS TO DOOLEY. HE ALSOREPORTED TO THE OPERATOR THAT THE POT SIGNAL ON THE #2 NE CONNECTION WAS YELLOW SINCE THE OPERATORCOULD NOT SEE IT FROM HIS SEAT. MUNOZ, STILL SITTING IN THEFIREMAN'S CHAIR, NOTICED THAT THE SWITCHFOR THE COAST CONNECTION WAS LINED WRONG. MUNOZ TOLD THE OPERATOR TO STOP THE MOVEMENT. DOOLEY STOPPED THE MOVEMENT, THINKING HE HAD RUN A RED SIGNAL. QUICKLY REVERSING THE ENGINE. THE LEADING TRUCKSOF THE MOVEMENT, PICKED THE SWITCH, CAUSING THE #2 TRUCK SET TO DERAIL. DOOLEY STATED HE WAS GOING APPROXIMATELY 5-6MPH.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
